intro: Blepharocalyx serra, commonly known as the serrated bellflower, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has smooth, glossy leaves and produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed by local wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
